conclusion: A drives towards the block group from the lower left.
A is positioned at the lower left of the image, moving towards the yellow block group.
A has enough power to reach the yellow block group based on its trajectory and speed.
Upon collision with the yellow block group, A will experience a deflection effect due to the impact.
The deflection effect will cause A to change direction and stop after colliding with the yellow blocks.
A will not have enough power to continue moving after the collision and will come to a stop.
The final position of A will be near the yellow block group, slightly deflected to the right.
